title: Authors and Citation
text: Fernando de Souza B, Rogério Jerônimo B, Marcos Oliveira P (2024). heckmanGE: Estimation Inference Heckman Selection Models Cluster-Robust Variance. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://github.com/fsbmat-ufv/heckmanGE.
code: @Manual{,   title = {heckmanGE: Estimation and Inference for Heckman Selection Models with Cluster-Robust Variance},   author = {Bastos {Fernando de Souza} and Barbosa {Rogério Jerônimo} and Prates {Marcos Oliveira}},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://github.com/fsbmat-ufv/heckmanGE}, }

title: Estimation and Inference for Heckman Selection Models with Cluster-Robust Variance
text: heckmanGE package functions modeling data selection bias problems. includes generalized Heckman model, introduced Bastos, Barreto-Souza, Genton (2022), allows inclusion covariates dispersion correlation parameters, allowing sample selection bias dispersion parameters depend covariates. , package allows inclusion sample weights grouping data clusters, way clusters errors independent, correlated within cluster. package also allows adjustment classical Heckman model (Heckman (1976), Heckman (1979)) estimation parameters model via maximum likelihood method two-step method.

title: Estimation and Inference for Heckman Selection Models with Cluster-Robust Variance
text: can install released version heckmanGE CRAN : development version GitHub :
code: install.packages("heckmanGE") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("fsbmat-ufv/heckmanGE")

title: Estimation and Inference for Heckman Selection Models with Cluster-Robust Variance
text: heckmanGE released Contributor Code Conduct.

what: Extract Coefficients from a Generalized Heckman Model — coef.heckmanGE
title: Extract Coefficients from a Generalized Heckman Model — coef.heckmanGE
text: function extracts coefficients heckmanGE class object. can specify parts model want retrieve coefficients : selection, outcome, dispersion, correlation. default, function returns complete coefficient vector parts.

title: Extract Coefficients from a Generalized Heckman Model — coef.heckmanGE
code: # S3 method for class 'heckmanGE' coef(   object,   part = c("selection", "outcome", "dispersion", "correlation"),   ... )

title: Extract Coefficients from a Generalized Heckman Model — coef.heckmanGE
text: object object class heckmanGE, contains fitted model. part character vector indicating parts model coefficients return. Valid options : "selection", "outcome", "dispersion", "correlation". Multiple parts can specified. default, parts included returned coefficients. ... Additional arguments passed methods. Currently, used method must included match generic method signature.

title: Extract Coefficients from a Generalized Heckman Model — coef.heckmanGE
text: numeric vector containing coefficients extracted model object. coefficients correspond specified model parts, returned order requested.

title: Extract Coefficients from a Generalized Heckman Model — coef.heckmanGE
text: coef.heckmanGE function retrieves coefficients heckmanGE model object based specified parts. parts represent different components Heckman model: "selection": Coefficients related selection equation. "outcome": Coefficients related outcome equation. "dispersion": Coefficients related dispersion equation. "correlation": Coefficients related correlation selection outcome. default, function returns coefficients parts. can specify one parts part argument extract coefficients specific components.

title: Extract Coefficients from a Generalized Heckman Model — coef.heckmanGE
code: data(MEPS2001) selectEq  <- dambexp ~ age + female + educ + blhisp + totchr + ins + income outcomeEq <- lnambx ~ age + female + educ + blhisp + totchr + ins dispersion  <- ~ age + female + totchr + ins correlation  <- ~ age fit <- heckmanGE(selection = selectEq,                  outcome = outcomeEq,                  dispersion = dispersion,                  correlation = correlation,                  data = MEPS2001) #> Error in eval(mfS): object 'selectEq' not found # Extracting all coefficients: coef(fit) #> Error: object 'fit' not found  # Extracting only the selection and outcome coefficients: coef(fit, part = c("selection", "outcome")) #> Error: object 'fit' not found

what: Compute Estimating Functions for Generalized Heckman Model — estfun.heckmanGE
title: Compute Estimating Functions for Generalized Heckman Model — estfun.heckmanGE
text: function calculates estimating functions (.e., gradient log-likelihood) Generalized Heckman model. primarily used model diagnostics inference, providing gradient observation respect model parameters.

title: Compute Estimating Functions for Generalized Heckman Model — estfun.heckmanGE
code: estfun.heckmanGE(x, ...)

title: Compute Estimating Functions for Generalized Heckman Model — estfun.heckmanGE
text: x object class heckmanGE, typically result fitting generalized Heckman model. object contain model responses, model matrices, weights, coefficient indexes necessary computation gradient. ... Additional arguments (currently used, reserved future extensions).

title: Compute Estimating Functions for Generalized Heckman Model — estfun.heckmanGE
text: matrix dimensions n x p, n number observations p number parameters model. element matrix corresponds gradient log-likelihood function respect given parameter observation.

title: Compute Estimating Functions for Generalized Heckman Model — estfun.heckmanGE
text: function computes gradient log-likelihood function Generalized Heckman model, includes selection, outcome, dispersion, correlation components. gradient calculated per observation, internally, helper function gradlik_gen_i computes gradient observation given model parameters. involves extracting components model matrices, weights, coefficient indexes, performing matrix operations specific model's structure.

title: Compute Estimating Functions for Generalized Heckman Model — estfun.heckmanGE
code: # Assuming 'model' is a fitted object of class 'heckmanGE': data(MEPS2001) selectEq  <- dambexp ~ age + female + educ + blhisp + totchr + ins + income outcomeEq <- lnambx ~ age + female + educ + blhisp + totchr + ins dispersion  <- ~ age + female + totchr + ins correlation  <- ~ age fit <- heckmanGE(selection = selectEq,                  outcome = outcomeEq,                  dispersion = dispersion,                  correlation = correlation,                  data = MEPS2001) #> Error in eval(mfS): object 'selectEq' not found estfun.heckmanGE(fit) #> Error: object 'fit' not found

title: fitheckmanGE — fitheckmanGE
text: Newton-Raphson Optimization Generalized Heckman Model Estimation

title: fitheckmanGE — fitheckmanGE
code: fitheckmanGE(start, YS, XS, YO, XO, Msigma, Mrho, w)

title: fitheckmanGE — fitheckmanGE
text: start numeric vector initial parameter guesses selection, outcome, dispersion, correlation equations. YS binary vector indicating selection status (1 selected, 0 otherwise). XS matrix independent variables selection equation. YO numeric vector observed outcomes (dependent variable) outcome equation. XO matrix independent variables outcome equation. Msigma matrix representing predictors dispersion parameter. Mrho matrix representing predictors correlation parameter. w numeric vector observation weights, used likelihood computation.

title: fitheckmanGE — fitheckmanGE
text: list following components: coefficients Named vector estimated coefficients selection, outcome, dispersion, correlation equations. fitted.values Named list fitted values equation (selection, outcome, dispersion, correlation). residuals Numeric vector residuals selection outcome equations. loglik Log-likelihood value fitted model. vcov Variance-covariance matrix estimated parameters. aic Akaike Information Criterion (AIC) model. bic Bayesian Information Criterion (BIC) model. optimization Details optimization process, including convergence information.

title: fitheckmanGE — fitheckmanGE
text: function estimates parameters generalized Heckman selection model using Newton-Raphson optimization algorithm. supports modeling selection outcome equations, along associated dispersion correlation structures. function uses Newton-Raphson algorithm estimate parameters generalized Heckman model, accounts sample selection bias. model composed selection equation (modeled YS XS), outcome equation (modeled YO XO), additional equations dispersion (Msigma) correlation (Mrho). optimization process maximizes log-likelihood model, allowing robust estimation selection bias, also estimating associated dispersion correlation parameters. function outputs coefficients, fitted values, residuals, several information criteria model comparison.

what: fitted.heckmanGE Extract Fitted Values of the Generalized Heckman Model — fitted.heckmanGE
title: fitted.heckmanGE Extract Fitted Values of the Generalized Heckman Model — fitted.heckmanGE

title: fitted.heckmanGE Extract Fitted Values of the Generalized Heckman Model — fitted.heckmanGE
text: object object class heckmanGE. object contain fitted values different parts model. part character vector specifying part model return fitted values . Options "selection", "outcome" (default), "dispersion", "correlation". multiple parts provided, "outcome" part returned. ... Additional arguments passed methods. used method must included match generic method signature.

title: fitted.heckmanGE Extract Fitted Values of the Generalized Heckman Model — fitted.heckmanGE
text: vector fitted values corresponding specified part heckmanGE model. type returned values depends part specified.

title: fitted.heckmanGE Extract Fitted Values of the Generalized Heckman Model — fitted.heckmanGE
text: part "selection", function returns fitted values selection part model. part "outcome", function returns fitted values outcome part model. part "dispersion", function returns fitted values dispersion part model. part "correlation", function returns fitted values correlation part model. part one specified options, error raised. multiple parts provided, function defaults returning fitted values outcome part model.

what: heckmanGE: A Package for Fitting Sample Selection Models — heckmanGE
title: heckmanGE: A Package for Fitting Sample Selection Models — heckmanGE
text: package provides functions fitting sample selection models, specifically Heckman-Ge model. includes functionality specifying selection outcome equations, well adjusting parameters dispersion correlation. Estimates parameters Generalized Heckman model

title: heckmanGE: A Package for Fitting Sample Selection Models — heckmanGE
code: heckmanGE(   selection,   outcome,   dispersion,   correlation,   data = sys.frame(sys.parent()),   weights = NULL,   cluster = NULL,   start = NULL )

title: heckmanGE: A Package for Fitting Sample Selection Models — heckmanGE
text: selection formula. Selection equation. outcome formula. Outcome Equation. dispersion right-handed formula. equation fitting Dispersion Parameter. correlation right-handed formula. equation fitting Correlation Parameter. data data.frame. weights optional vector weights used fitting process. NULL numeric vector. cluster variable indicating clustering observations, list (data.frame) thereof, formula specifying variables fitted model used. See documentation sandwich::vcovCL. formula list specifying clusters robust standard errors. Clustering adjusts standard errors accounting correlations within clusters. start Optional. numeric vector initial values parameters.

title: heckmanGE: A Package for Fitting Sample Selection Models — heckmanGE
text: list results fitted model, including parameter estimates, Hessian matrix, number observations, relevant statistics. initial values provided, function estimates using Heckman two-step method. list containing: call matched function call. coefficients Estimated coefficients selection, outcome, dispersion, correlation equations. vcov covariance matrix estimated coefficients. logLik log-likelihood fitted model. model.frames List model frames equation (selection, outcome, dispersion, correlation). fitted.values Fitted values outcome equation.

title: heckmanGE: A Package for Fitting Sample Selection Models — heckmanGE
text: Optimized Function fitting Generalized Heckman Model (original version: package ssmodels. Modified Rogerio Barbosa) heckmanGE() function fits generalization Heckman sample selection model, allowing sample selection bias dispersion parameters depend covariates. heckmanGE() function fits generalization Heckman sample selection model, compatible robust variance-covariance estimation using packages sandwich. particular, vcovCL function can used clustering, adjusts standard errors accounting intra-cluster correlations data.

title: heckmanGE: A Package for Fitting Sample Selection Models — heckmanGE
text: Fernando de Souza Bastos

title: heckmanGE: A Package for Fitting Sample Selection Models — heckmanGE
code: data(MEPS2001) selectEq  <- dambexp ~ age + female + educ + blhisp + totchr + ins + income outcomeEq <- lnambx ~ age + female + educ + blhisp + totchr + ins dispersion  <- ~ age + female + totchr + ins correlation  <- ~ age fit <- heckmanGE(selection = selectEq,                  outcome = outcomeEq,                  dispersion = dispersion,                  correlation = correlation,                  data = MEPS2001) #> Error in eval(mfS): object 'selectEq' not found summary(fit) #> Error: object 'fit' not found

code: meat.heckmanGE(x, adjust = FALSE, ...)

title: meat.heckmanGE Compute Meat of the Covariance Matrix for the Generalized Heckman Model — meat.heckmanGE
text: x object class heckmanGE. object fitted model covariance matrix computed. adjust logical value indicating whether apply small-sample correction covariance matrix. TRUE, matrix adjusted multiplying n / (n - k), n number observations k number parameters. ... Additional arguments passed estfun.heckmanGE, computes estimating functions used calculation.

title: meat.heckmanGE Compute Meat of the Covariance Matrix for the Generalized Heckman Model — meat.heckmanGE
text: matrix representing "meat" covariance matrix. dimensions row/column names matrix correspond number parameters model.

title: meat.heckmanGE Compute Meat of the Covariance Matrix for the Generalized Heckman Model — meat.heckmanGE
text: function calculates covariance matrix based estimating functions obtained estfun.heckmanGE. "meat" calculated cross-product estimating functions, divided number observations. adjust TRUE, small-sample correction applied.

title: meatCL.heckmanGE Compute the Meat Matrix for a Heckman-Ge Model with Clustering — meatCL.heckmanGE
text: x object class heckmanGE containing results Heckman-Ge model fit. cluster vector data frame specifying cluster variable(s). NULL, default clustering variable used. type type heteroscedasticity-consistent (HC) estimator use. Options "HC0", "HC1", "HC2", "HC3". Defaults "HC0". cadjust logical value indicating whether adjust number clusters. Defaults TRUE. multi0 logical value indicating whether include column ones cluster variable matrix. Defaults FALSE. ... Additional arguments passed methods.

title: meatCL.heckmanGE Compute the Meat Matrix for a Heckman-Ge Model with Clustering — meatCL.heckmanGE

what: Medical Expenditure Panel Survey (MEPS) Data — MEPS2001
title: Medical Expenditure Panel Survey (MEPS) Data — MEPS2001
text: MEPS dataset contains large-scale survey data United States, focusing health services usage, costs, insurance coverage. dataset restricted individuals aged 21 64 years. includes outpatient cost data zero expenditure values model adjustment.

title: Medical Expenditure Panel Survey (MEPS) Data — MEPS2001
code: MEPS2001

title: Medical Expenditure Panel Survey (MEPS) Data — MEPS2001
text: data frame 3328 observations following variables: educ: Education status (numeric) age: Age (numeric) income: Income (numeric) female: Gender (binary) vgood: Self-reported health status, good (numeric) good: Self-reported health status, good (numeric) hospexp: Hospital expenditures (numeric) totchr: Total number chronic diseases (numeric) ffs: Family support (numeric) dhospexp: Dummy variable hospital expenditures (binary) age2: Age squared (numeric) agefem: Interaction age gender (numeric) fairpoor: Self-reported health status, fair poor (numeric) year01: Year survey (numeric) instype: Type insurance (numeric) ambexp: Ambulatory expenditures (numeric) lambexp: Log ambulatory expenditures (numeric) blhisp: Ethnicity (binary) instype_s1: Insurance type, version 1 (numeric) dambexp: Dummy variable ambulatory expenditures (binary) lnambx: Log-transformed ambulatory expenditures (numeric) ins: Insurance status (binary)

title: Medical Expenditure Panel Survey (MEPS) Data — MEPS2001
text: 2001 Medical Expenditure Panel Survey Agency Healthcare Research Quality.

title: Medical Expenditure Panel Survey (MEPS) Data — MEPS2001
code: data(MEPS2001) selectEq  <- dambexp ~ age + female + educ + blhisp + totchr + ins + income outcomeEq <- lnambx ~ age + female + educ + blhisp + totchr + ins dispersion  <- ~ age + female + totchr + ins correlation  <- ~ age fit <- heckmanGE(selection = selectEq,                 outcome = outcomeEq,                 dispersion = dispersion,                 correlation = correlation,                 data = MEPS2001) #> Error in eval(mfS): object 'selectEq' not found summary(fit) #> Error: object 'fit' not found

title: PNAD Continua de 2024, 2 trimestre — pnadC_y2024q2
text: Continuous National Household Sample Survey (PNAD Continua) second quarter 2024 important source statistical data Brazil, conducted Brazilian Institute Geography Statistics (IBGE). survey aims provide --date information socioeconomic characteristics Brazilian population, covering topics employment, income, education, crucial aspects formulation public policies economic social studies.

title: PNAD Continua de 2024, 2 trimestre — pnadC_y2024q2
code: pnadC_y2024q2

title: PNAD Continua de 2024, 2 trimestre — pnadC_y2024q2
text: data frame 326018 observations following variables: PSU: Primary Sampling Unit identifier (factor) weight: Survey weight (numeric) age: Age respondent (numeric) participation: Labor force participation status (factor) male: Male indicator (binary) white: White indicator (binary) hhold_head: Household head indicator (binary) hhold_spouse: Spouse household head indicator (binary) yearsSchooling: Total years schooling completed (numeric) classWorker_employer: Employer indicator (binary) classWorker_selfEmployed: Self-employed indicator (binary) ln_salary: Natural logarithm salary (numeric)

title: PNAD Continua de 2024, 2 trimestre — pnadC_y2024q2
code: data(pnadC_y2024q2) attach(pnadC_y2024q2) selectEq  <- participation ~ age + I(age^2) +  male + white + yearsSchooling +  hhold_head + hhold_spouse outcomeEq <- ln_salary ~ age + I(age^2) +  male + white + yearsSchooling +  classWorker_employer + classWorker_selfEmployed outcomeD  <- ~ age + I(age^2) +  male + white + yearsSchooling +  classWorker_employer + classWorker_selfEmployed outcomeC  <- ~ male + yearsSchooling fit_heckmanGE <- heckmanGE(selection   = selectEq,                            outcome     = outcomeEq,                            dispersion  = outcomeD,                            correlation = outcomeC,                            data = pnadC_y2024q2,                            weights = weight,                            cluster = ~PSU) #> Error in eval(mfS): object 'selectEq' not found                            summary(fit_heckmanGE) #> Error: object 'fit_heckmanGE' not found

what: predict.heckmanGE Predictions from the Generalized Heckman Model — predict.heckmanGE
title: predict.heckmanGE Predictions from the Generalized Heckman Model — predict.heckmanGE
text: Generates predictions fitted heckmanGE model. Predictions can made scale linear predictors scale response variable. function can also return confidence intervals predictions requested.

title: predict.heckmanGE Predictions from the Generalized Heckman Model — predict.heckmanGE
code: # S3 method for class 'heckmanGE' predict(   object,   part = c("selection", "outcome", "dispersion", "correlation"),   newdata = NULL,   type = c("link", "response"),   cofint = F,   confidence_level = 0.95 )

title: predict.heckmanGE Predictions from the Generalized Heckman Model — predict.heckmanGE
text: object object class heckmanGE. object fitted model predictions made. part character vector specifying model part make predictions. Options include "selection", "outcome", "dispersion", "correlation". default "outcome". multiple parts specified, "outcome" part used. newdata Optionally, data frame containing new data making predictions. omitted, function uses fitted linear predictors model object. type type prediction required. default "link", returns predictions scale linear predictors. "response" specified, predictions returned scale response variable applying inverse link function. cofint logical indicating whether return confidence intervals predictions. Default FALSE. confidence_level numeric value specifying confidence level confidence intervals cofint TRUE. Default 0.95.

title: predict.heckmanGE Predictions from the Generalized Heckman Model — predict.heckmanGE
text: vector matrix predictions heckmanGE object, depending value cofint. cofint TRUE, function returns matrix mean predicted value, lower upper bounds confidence interval.

title: predict.heckmanGE Predictions from the Generalized Heckman Model — predict.heckmanGE
text: function first checks validity part type arguments. newdata provided, function ensures matches variables structure original model frame. Predictions can link scale response scale, depending type argument. Confidence intervals calculated cofint TRUE, using standard errors derived model.

what: Simulation dataset for the heckmanGE example — simulation
title: Simulation dataset for the heckmanGE example — simulation
text: dataset contains simulated data used illustrate functionality heckmanGE model. data includes variables used selection, outcome, dispersion, correlation equations.

title: Simulation dataset for the heckmanGE example — simulation
code: simulation

title: Simulation dataset for the heckmanGE example — simulation
text: data frame 10,000 observations following variables: y_o: Outcome variable simulated model (numeric) y_s: Selection indicator, 1 selected, 0 otherwise (binary) prob_s: Probability selection (numeric) x1: Simulated predictor normal distribution (numeric) x2: Simulated predictor Poisson distribution (numeric) x3: Simulated binary predictor (binary) x4: Simulated predictor normal distribution mean 2 sd 2 (numeric) x5: Simulated predictor Poisson distribution lambda 1.5 (numeric)

title: Simulation dataset for the heckmanGE example — simulation
code: data(simulation) selectEq  <- y_s ~ x1 + x2 + x4 outcomeEq <- y_o ~ x1 + x2 + x3 outcomeD  <- ~ x1 + x5 outcomeC  <- ~ x3 + x4 fit_heckmanGE <- heckmanGE(selection   = selectEq,                            outcome     = outcomeEq,                            dispersion  = outcomeD,                            correlation = outcomeC,                            data = simulation) #> Error in eval(mfS): object 'selectEq' not found summary(fit_heckmanGE) #> Error: object 'fit_heckmanGE' not found

title: step2: Two-Step Estimation Function — step2
text: function performs two-step estimation process, commonly used models require correction sample selection bias. estimates parameters selection, outcome, dispersion equations.

title: step2: Two-Step Estimation Function — step2
code: step2(YS, XS, YO, XO, Msigma, Mrho, w)

title: step2: Two-Step Estimation Function — step2
text: YS binary numeric vector indicating selection (1 selected, 0 otherwise). XS numeric matrix covariates selection equation. Rows correspond observations columns covariates. YO numeric vector observed outcomes selected sample (YS == 1). XO numeric matrix covariates outcome equation. Rows correspond selected observations. Msigma numeric matrix covariates dispersion equation. Mrho numeric matrix covariates correlation structure equation. w numeric vector weights used estimation process.

title: step2: Two-Step Estimation Function — step2
text: list following elements: selection Estimated coefficients selection equation (probit model). outcome Estimated coefficients outcome equation (weighted least squares). dispersion Estimated coefficients dispersion equation (log residual variance). correlation Initial guesses coefficients correlation structure.

title: step2: Two-Step Estimation Function — step2
text: function implements two-step estimation method models sample selection bias. process begins estimating selection equation using probit model model probability selection. Inverse Mills Ratio (IMR) computed probit model added covariate outcome dispersion equations correct sample selection bias. outcome equation estimated using weighted least squares (WLS), residuals used estimate dispersion equation. Additionally, initial estimates correlation structure computed based fitted values outcome equation.

what: Variance-Covariance with Cluster Correction for Heckman Models — vcovCL.heckmanGE
title: Variance-Covariance with Cluster Correction for Heckman Models — vcovCL.heckmanGE
text: vcovCL.heckmanGE function computes variance-covariance matrix Heckman model, applying cluster correction. useful obtaining robust variance estimates, especially within-group dependence.

title: Variance-Covariance with Cluster Correction for Heckman Models — vcovCL.heckmanGE
code: vcovCL.heckmanGE(   x,   cluster = NULL,   type = NULL,   sandwich = TRUE,   fix = FALSE,   ... )

title: Variance-Covariance with Cluster Correction for Heckman Models — vcovCL.heckmanGE
text: x object resulting estimation Heckman model using heckmanGE method. cluster vector factor identifying clusters data. NULL, assumes clustering. type character string specifying type cluster correction applied. can "HC0", "HC1", "HC2", "HC3". sandwich logical value. TRUE, function applies sandwich estimator variance-covariance matrix. fix logical value. TRUE, corrects negative eigenvalues variance-covariance matrix. ... Additional arguments can passed internal methods.

title: Variance-Covariance with Cluster Correction for Heckman Models — vcovCL.heckmanGE
text: corrected variance-covariance matrix.

title: Variance-Covariance with Cluster Correction for Heckman Models — vcovCL.heckmanGE
text: function specialized implementation obtaining robust variance-covariance matrix Heckman models estimated heckmanGE. allows cluster correction, particularly important contexts observations within groups may independent.
